question: Which of the following statement is correct?

options.A: Class is an instance of object.
options.B: Object is an instance of a class.
options.C: Class is an instance of data type.
options.D: Object is an instance of data type.

question: Which of the following is not a type of inheritance?

What happens if the base and derived class contains definition of a function with same prototype?

options.A: Compiler reports an error on compilation.
options.B: Only base class function will get called irrespective of object.
options.C: Only derived class function will get called irrespective of object.
options.D: Base class object will call base class function and derived class object will call derived class function.

question: Which of the following is a mechanism of static polymorphism?

options.A: The default value for an argument can be a global constant.
options.B: The default arguments are given in the function prototype.
options.C: Compiler uses the prototype information to build a call, not the function definition.
options.D: The default arguments are given in the function prototype and should be repeated in the function definition.

question: Which of the following function / type of function cannot be overloaded?

options.A: An array of references is acceptable.
options.B: Once a reference variable has been defined to refer to a particular variable it can refer to any other variable.
options.C: An array of references is not acceptable.

question: Which of the following statement is correct?

options.A: A reference is a constant pointer.
options.B: A reference is not a constant pointer.
options.C: An array of references is acceptable.
options.D: It is possible to create a reference to a reference.

question: Which of the following statement is correct with respect to the use of friend keyword inside a class?

options.A: A private data member can be declared as a friend.
options.B: A class may be declared as a friend.
options.C: An object may be declared as a friend.
options.D: We can use friend keyword as a class name.

question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.A: Data items in a class must be private.
options.B: Both data and functions can be either private or public.
options.C: Member functions of a class must be private.
options.D: Constructor of a class cannot be private.

question: Which of the following means "The use of an object of one class in definition of another class"?

options.A: A destructor has void return type.
options.B: A destructor has integer return type.
options.C: A destructor has no return type.
options.D: A destructors return type is always same as that of main().

question: When are the Global objects destroyed?

options.A: When the control comes out of the block in which they are being used.
options.C: When the control comes out of the function in which they are being used.
options.D: As soon as local objects die.
